DOC.brief_summary: In modern cardiac surgery and cardiology Transcatheter Aortic Valve Implantation (TAVI) is an emerging procedure for high-risk patients that are assumed to be otherwise inoperable. The investigators want to evaluate the specific intraoperative anesthesiologic characteristics cardiac anesthesiologists have to face during these procedures.
